channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NE

item.title: Report E-2023110043
item.description:
Report E-2023110043

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: LA VISTA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCF experienced a customer location release of UN2693 Sodium Bisulfite Solution 40% from (3) 275-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 30’ area of the trailer and concrete lot below. The release occurred due to high temps expanding the totes/loose caps as well as small puncture holes in the tote bodies. The material in the three totes were transferred into new totes. Soda ash was utilized to neutralize the release & absorbents were then deployed to clean all released product. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged totes were then cut up and containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.
